This module contains the code that the user will interface with directly along with the transport engines and the engine interfaces.

class CiscoAutomationFramework.Framework.CAF(engine, destination, username, password, enable_password=None)¶

This is the class that the user will interface with, this class is responsible for detecting the firmware of the device and then issuing commands based on that firmware version.

configure_access_vlan(interface, vlan)¶

this method should be used when the user needs to configure an interface as an access port on a specific vlan

Parameters:
  • interface – interface to configure ex. gi1/0/1, fa0/1, etc.
  • vlan – Vlan number to configure
Returns:

commands sent to server and their output
configure_description(interface, description)¶
Parameters:
  • interface – Interface to configure discription on
  • description – str description to configure the interface with
Returns:
delete_local_user(username)¶
Parameters:username – Username to delete
Returns:
detect_firmware()¶

Detects the firmware running on the remote device by counting the number of times specific keywords are called out in the ‘show version’ command and tallies them up and returns the one with the highest result

Returns:str IOSXE, IOS, NXOS, ASA
find_mac_address(mac_address)¶

Searches the MAC address table for a MAC address entry

Parameters:mac_address – MAC address or partial MAC address to search for
Returns:List [Mac Address, Interface ]
get_local_users()¶

Method to extract the local users configured on the system out of the running config

Returns:List of the users configured locally on the system
get_uptime()¶

Gets the uptime of the remote device

Returns:str System uptime
instantiate_object()¶

Sets up self.ssh to reference the proper module based on the IOS version of the devicve

Returns:SSH object to interface with remote device
Return type:object
last_input_and_output(interface)¶
Parameters:interface – Interface you wish to check the last input & output on
Returns:a list [Interface, Last Input, Last Output]
list_down_ports()¶

Issues show interface description command, skips any vlan or port channel interfaces, also skips any interfaces that are not ‘down’ all others are considered physical interfaces in an ‘up’ status and will add those interface names to a list to return that list to the user

Returns:List of physical interfaces in an ‘up’ status
list_eigrp_configuration()¶
Returns:EIGRP Configuration
list_ospf_configuration()¶
Returns:OSPF Configuration
mac_address_table()¶
Returns:List of lists containing the MAC address table and its contents
physical_port_inventory()¶

Gathers an inventory of physical ports on the remote device

Returns:List of physical interfaces on device
physical_port_inventory_longname()¶

Gathers an inventory of physical ports on the remote device with their full name ex. GigabitEthernet1/0/1 vs their abbreviated name ex. Gi1/0/1

Returns:list of ports
port_status()¶
Returns:
power_inline(summary=False)¶

Method to get the power inline statics for remote POE device

Parameters:summary – bool if set to true it will get the overview information and not the individual port information
Returns:list of lists containing the power inline details
priv_exec()¶

Enters privilege exec mode, will exit config T if you are in config t, and elevate from standard user mode if you are in standard user mode

Returns:Output from command
show_interface_description()¶

Sets terminal length to infinite, issues show interface description command, gathers output from remote device, split in a list by line

Returns:List of output, split by line in output
show_interface_status()¶
Returns:
show_routes()¶

‘ Returns list of lists containing the routing table.

show_run()¶

Issues ‘show running-config’ command to to the remote router/switch

Returns:output from command
show_run_interface(interface)¶
Parameters:interface – Interface to capture the running config of
Returns:Running Configuration of specified interface
write_mem()¶

Saves the running configuration to startup configuration

Returns:
class CiscoAutomationFramework.Framework.TransportInterface(engine)¶

This class is a polymorphic interface that allows CAF and firmware specific code downstream to seamlessly interface with the ssh and serial engines. It is responsible for handling calls from CAF and sending them to either the SSH or Serial engine depending on what the user has specified

transport_factory()¶

Factory function that will return an object that points to the proper engine the user has specified to use

Returns:Engine object
Raises:EngineNotSelected – Error raised if the user did not pass the proper string for which engine they wished to use

class CiscoAutomationFramework.Util.CredCheck(transport, listofipsorserialinterface)¶

This class contains methods to test user authentication both to the switch/router and into enable mode.

cli_run_no_enable()¶

CLI utility to gather a username and password and test its authentication against a cisco device, this method will loop until a username and password combination is accepted

Returns:List containing username and password
Return type:list
cli_run_with_enable()¶

CLI utility to gather both a username and password combination and an enable password, this will loop until a successful username and password combination and enable password is received.

Returns:List containing username, password, and enable password.
Return type:List
decide_ip_to_use(list_of_IP_addresses)¶

Cycles through list of IP addresses provided pinging each one and will return the first one that responds to ping

Parameters:list_of_IP_addresses (list) – list of IP addresses that we can use to check authentication against
Returns:first IP that responds to ping
gather_enable()¶

CLI method to gather an enable password

Returns:Enable password entered by user
Return type:str
gather_user_pass()¶

CLI method to gather a username and password

Returns:List containing username and password
Return type:list
test_enable(username, password, enable_password)¶

Method to test an enable password and validate it is able to elevate privilege into enable mode

Note

The Username and Password supplied must be previously tested to have access

Parameters:
  • username (str) – Confirmed working username for the device
  • password (str) – Confirmed working password that corresponds to the username
  • enable_password (str) – Enable password to attempt authentication with
Returns:

True/False depending on if the enable password is accepted or not
Return type:

bool
test_user_pass(username, password)¶

Method to test a username and password against a router or switch

Parameters:
  • username (str) – Username to supply to the device
  • password (str) – Password to supply to the device
Returns:

True or False depending if the username and password were accepted
Return type:

bool
class CiscoAutomationFramework.Util.PingTest¶

Class that contains code for doing ping tests against network devices

classmethod ping(ipaddr)¶

Method that sends a basic ping to an IP address and returns true or false depending on if there was a response received.

Parameters:ipaddr (String) – IP address to run a ping test against
Returns:True if a response is received False if there is no response
